title: Number Expressions
description: How well do you know phrases and idioms involving numbers? From 'the whole nine yards' to 'at sixes and sevens'!

questions.question: What does 'the whole nine yards' mean?
options: Everything possible or the full extent

questions.question: If you are 'at sixes and sevens,' how are you feeling?
options: Confused or in a state of disarray

questions.question: What does 'a stitch in time saves nine' mean?
options: Fixing a problem early prevents bigger problems later
Nine stitches are needed for every repair

questions.question: If someone has 'nine lives,' what quality do they have?
options: They live in nine different places

questions.question: What does 'back to square one' mean?
options: Returning to the very beginning after a setback
Going back to work on Monday

questions.question: If something is 'a dime a dozen,' what does that mean?
options: It is very common and not particularly valuable
It is sold in groups of twelve

questions.question: What does 'two heads are better than one' mean?
If you 'put two and two together,' what are you doing?
options: Drawing an obvious conclusion from available evidence

questions.question: What does 'dressed to the nines' mean?
options: Dressed in very fancy or elegant clothing

questions.question: If someone is a 'ten-percenter,' what are they traditionally known as?
options: An agent who takes a 10% commission

questions.question: What does 'catch-22' refer to?
options: A paradoxical situation with no easy escape

questions.question: If you take 'forty winks,' what are you doing?
What does 'one in a million' describe?
options: Something or someone exceptionally rare or special

questions.question: If something happens 'once in a blue moon,' how often does it occur?
What does 'the third degree' mean when given to someone?
